description: Biden had promised to visit soon after the derailment. He has faced criticism from some residents and from former President Donald Trump, who made a trip to the community shortly after the disaster.
title: Biden visits East Palestine a year after a train derailment changed the Ohio town

description: Israeli forces have found no hostage remains so far, but their raid has essentially rendered the largest hospital in Gaza's Khan Younis nonfunctional.
title: Searching for the remains of hostages, Israeli forces raid another Gaza hospital

description: A New York judge has ordered former President Donald Trump and executives at the Trump Organization to pay nearly $364 million.
title: Trump ordered to pay $350 million for fraudulent business practices in New York

description: Alexander Smirnov has been indicted for making false statements to the FBI — claims that House Republicans have used in their probe of President Biden.
title: How the ex-FBI informant charged with lying is tied to the Biden impeachment inquiry

description: Russian authorities announced on Friday that opposition leader Alexei Navalny had died in a remote Russian prison. Navalny was imprisoned after returning to Russia in 2021.
title: In Navalny's final hours of freedom, he was calm, funny and watching 'Rick and Morty'

description: The death of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny in prison was shocking, but hardly surprising. It follows a long line of fallen critics and opponents of Russian leader Vladimir Putin.
title: Alexei Navalny is the latest Putin critic to die in suspicious circumstances

description: Recently, conversation about the age of the 2024 presidential candidates has risen to a fever pitch. That's the sign of a deeper problem with how our culture views aging.
title: How ageism against Biden and Trump puts older folks at risk

description: After speculation the powerful centrist Democrat would run third-party, Manchin announced Friday he would not be running for president in the 2024 election. But he did not endorse a candidate.
title: After months of speculation, Sen. Joe Manchin will not run for president in 2024

description: Fears over how AI could be used to mislead voters are escalating in a year that will see hundreds of millions of people around the world cast ballots. As a result, tech giants are pledging action.
title: Tech giants pledge action against deceptive AI in elections

description: The Russian opposition leader was a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin. He was known for organizing nationwide protests against election fraud and government corruption.
title: Photos: See Russian anti-corruption leader Alexei Navalny's life in pictures

description: Women are taking their rightful place in Rio's "carnival of the streets" — the "bate-bolas," translated literally, as ball beaters.
title: Women are breaking Brazil's 'bate bola' carnival mold

description: The scoring records of two Black American college basketball stars from the 1970s and 1980s are overlooked by the NCAA as Caitlin Clark takes the mantle as women's scoring champion.
title: Caitlin Clark's scoring record reveals legacies of Lynette Woodard and Pearl Moore

description: In a sign of Navalny's ability to inspire the public, in 2017 his followers chanted words in Putin's hometown that are among the most dangerous to utter in their country: "Russia without Putin."
title: Navalny's legacy: His ceaseless crusade against Putin and corruption

description: The international reaction to the death of the prominent Russian opposition leader was swift, with many blaming the Kremlin.
title: The world reacts to the death of Navalny, a top critic of Russian President Putin

description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny died in prison after losing consciousness after a walk, according to the country's prison service. Israeli troops take over Southern Gaza's largest hospital.
title: Alexei Navalny has died in prison; Israeli troops raid Gaza's Nasser Hospital

description: National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan spoke to NPR's Morning Edition about Alexei Navalny dying in prison — and his briefing of U.S. congressional leaders on new Russian "anti-satellite capability."
title: Jake Sullivan says the U.S. is engaging with allies, and Russia, on the space threat

description: New laws will allow automated speed cameras in places where they've long been banned. Advocates say they can save lives, but critics argue they're a financial burden on those least able to pay.
title: Eyes on the road: Automated speed cameras get a fresh look as traffic deaths mount

description: Keith's death shined a new spotlight on his music, particularly political anthem "Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue," best known for its lyric: "We'll put a boot in your ass, it's the American way."
title: Toby Keith's 'Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue' lives on in MAGA country

description: Keith's death shined a new spotlight on his music, particularly political anthem "Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue," best known for its lyric: "We'll put a boot in your ass, it's the American way."
title: Toby Keith's 'Courtesy of the Red, White and Blue' lives on in MAGA country

description: The case accused leaders of the National Rifle Association of corruption and misspending and now heads to the jury, which is expected to begin deliberations Friday.
title: Lawsuit accusing NRA of lavish misspending now heads to jury

description:
Every year, billions of animals across the globe embark on journeys. They fly, crawl, walk or slither – often across thousands of miles of land or water – to find better food, more agreeable weather or a place to breed. Think monarch butterflies, penguins, wild Pacific salmon. These species are crucial to the world as we know it. But until this week, there has never been an official assessment of the world's migratory animals.

So today on the show, correspondent Nate Rott shares the first-ever report on state of the world's migratory animals – the threats facing them and what can be done to help.

Are you afraid of needles or shots? Send us a voice memo with your story at shortwave@npr.org. We'd love to hear about it for an upcoming episode.
title: Migrating animals undergo perilous journeys every year. Humans make it more dangerous

description: The Iowa senior now holds the NCAA women's points record. Here's how she got this far — and what it means for the sport.
title: Caitlin Clark — a 'tsunami of impact and influence' — breaks the NCAA scoring record

description: Rep. Matt Rosendale has ended his bid for the Senate less than a week after he launched his campaign. He said in a statement he lacks resources and that the "hill was just too steep to climb."
title: Montana GOP lawmaker quickly drops Senate bid, citing Trump's endorsement of opponent
